fluorine.gloss: a nonmetallic univalent element belonging to the halogens

fluoroscope.gloss: an X-ray machine that combines an X-ray source and a fluorescent screen to enable direct observation

flurazepam hydrochloride.gloss: tranquilizer (trade name Dalmane) used to treat insomnia

flush.gloss: of a surface exactly even with an adjoining one, forming the same plane

flush toilet.gloss: a toilet that is cleaned of waste by the flow of water through it

fluster.gloss: a disposition that is confused or nervous and upset

flute.gloss: a groove or furrow in cloth etc (particularly a shallow concave groove on the shaft of a column)

fluting.gloss: a groove or furrow in cloth etc (particularly a shallow concave groove on the shaft of a column)

flutter.gloss: move back and forth very rapidly

fluttering.gloss: the motion made by flapping up and down

flux.gloss: move or progress freely as if in a stream
become liquid or fluid when heated

flux density.gloss: (physics) the number of changes in energy flow across a given surface per unit area

fluxing lime.gloss: a white crystalline oxide used in the production of calcium hydroxide

fly-by.gloss: a flight at a low altitude (usually of military aircraft) over spectators on the ground

fly ball.gloss: (baseball) a hit that flies up in the air

fly bridge.gloss: the highest navigational bridge on a ship

fly floor.gloss: a narrow raised platform at the side of a stage in a theater

fly front.gloss: an opening in a garment that is closed by a zipper or by buttons concealed under a fold of cloth

fly honeysuckle.gloss: erect deciduous North American shrub with yellow-white flowers

fly poison.gloss: all parts of plant are highly toxic

fly sheet.gloss: flap consisting of a piece of canvas that can be drawn back to provide entrance to a tent

flybridge.gloss: the highest navigational bridge on a ship

flycatcher.gloss: any of a large group of small songbirds that feed on insects taken on the wing

flyer.gloss: an advertisement (usually printed on a page or in a leaflet) intended for wide distribution

flying bird.gloss: birds having keeled breastbones for attachment of flight muscles

flying bomb.gloss: a small jet-propelled winged missile that carries a bomb

flying bridge.gloss: the highest navigational bridge on a ship

flying buttress.gloss: a buttress that stands apart from the main structure and connected to it by an arch

flying cat.gloss: arboreal nocturnal mammal of southeast Asia and the Philippines resembling a lemur and having a fold of skin on each side from neck to tail that is used for long gliding leaps

flying dragon.gloss: any of several small tropical Asian lizards capable of gliding by spreading winglike membranes on each side of the body

flying drainpipe.gloss: a simple type of jet engine

flying field.gloss: a place where planes take off and land

flying gecko.gloss: a gecko that has membranous expansions along the sides of its body and limbs and tail that enable it to glide short distances

flying gurnard.gloss: tropical fish with huge fanlike pectoral fins for underwater gliding

flying lemur.gloss: arboreal nocturnal mammal of southeast Asia and the Philippines resembling a lemur and having a fold of skin on each side from neck to tail that is used for long gliding leaps

flying lizard.gloss: any of several small tropical Asian lizards capable of gliding by spreading winglike membranes on each side of the body

flying opossum.gloss: nocturnal phalangers that move with gliding leaps using parachute-like folds of skin along the sides of the body

flying phalanger.gloss: nocturnal phalangers that move with gliding leaps using parachute-like folds of skin along the sides of the body

flying reptile.gloss: an extinct reptile of the Jurassic and Cretaceous having a bird-like beak and membranous wings supported by the very long fourth digit of each forelimb

flying robin.gloss: tropical fish with huge fanlike pectoral fins for underwater gliding

flying saucer.gloss: an (apparently) flying object whose nature is unknown

flying squirrel.gloss: nocturnal phalangers that move with gliding leaps using parachute-like folds of skin along the sides of the body

flyover.gloss: bridge formed by the upper level of a crossing of two highways at different levels

flout.gloss: laugh at with contempt and derision

flummox.gloss: be a mystery or bewildering to
